text: {{Infobox writer |name = Dobrica Erić |image = Dobrica Erić photo.jpg |imagesize = 200px |caption = Erić at the Belgrade Book Fair in 2004 |birth_date = |death_date = |death_place = Belgrade, Serbia |birth_place = Donja Crnuća, Kingdom of Yugoslavia |children = |occupation = Writer, Comics writer |nationality = Serbian |period = 1959–2019 |genre = |notableworks = |influences = |influenced = |website = }} Dobrica Erić (; August 22, 1936 – March 29, 2019) was a Serbian writer and poet.Zdravko Zupan, Vek stripa u Srbiji, Kulturni centar – Galerija savremene umetnosti, Pančevo, 2007. He was the author of many novels, five books of romantic poetry, 23 poetry books, 5 theatre dramas and over 40 children's books. His first book of poetry was published in 1959. His works have been translated into many languages. He lived and worked in Belgrade and Gruža. Erić died in Belgrade on March 29, 2019 from lung cancer at the age of 82.Preminuo Dobrica Erić ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Yugoslavian poets Category:Serbian poets Category:European novelists Category:People from Belgrade
